verses.kjv: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
verses.ct: My son, hold on to what I say, and store my instructions deep inside you.

verses.kjv: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
verses.ct: Follow my instructions and you will live; guard my teaching like you would protect your own eyes.

verses.kjv: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
verses.ct: Tie them around your fingers, and engrave them on your heart.

verses.kjv: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
verses.ct: Tell wisdom, 'You are my sister,' and treat understanding like a close relative.

verses.kjv: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
verses.ct: They will protect you from the immoral woman, from the seductive stranger who lures with her words.

verses.kjv: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
verses.ct: One day I was looking out through the window of my house,

verses.kjv: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
verses.ct: and I noticed among the naive crowd — I spotted among the young men — one who had no sense at all.

verses.kjv: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
verses.ct: He was walking down the street near her corner, heading straight toward her house,

verses.kjv: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
verses.ct: at dusk, as evening fell, as deep darkness settled in.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
verses.ct: Then a woman came out to meet him, dressed like a prostitute and with cunning intentions.

verses.kjv: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
verses.ct: (She is loud and defiant; she never stays at home.

verses.kjv: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
verses.ct: One moment she's outside, the next she's in the streets, lurking at every corner.)

verses.kjv: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
verses.ct: She grabbed him and kissed him, and with a shameless expression she told him,

verses.kjv: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
verses.ct: "I made my fellowship offerings today; I've fulfilled my vows.

verses.kjv: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
verses.ct: That's why I came out looking for you — I was searching eagerly for you, and here you are!

verses.kjv: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
verses.ct: I've spread my bed with beautiful covers, with colorful linens imported from Egypt.

verses.kjv: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.ct: I've scented my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

verses.kjv: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
verses.ct: Come, let's lose ourselves in passion all night long; let's enjoy each other's embrace until morning.

verses.kjv: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
verses.ct: My husband isn't home — he left on a long trip.

verses.kjv: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
verses.ct: He took a full bag of money with him and won't be back until the scheduled date."

verses.kjv: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
verses.ct: With all her smooth talk she persuaded him; with her flattering lips she led him astray.

verses.kjv: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
verses.ct: He followed her right away, like an ox being led to slaughter, or like a fool walking into punishment in chains,

verses.kjv: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
verses.ct: until an arrow pierced his liver — like a bird rushing into a trap, not realizing it will cost him his life.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
verses.ct: So listen to me now, my sons, and pay close attention to what I'm saying.

verses.kjv: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
verses.ct: Don't let your heart drift toward her ways, and don't wander down her paths.

verses.kjv: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
verses.ct: She has brought down many victims; even powerful men have been destroyed by her.

verses.kjv: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
verses.ct: Her house is the road to the grave, leading down to the rooms of death.
